intro: Aerides jarckiana, commonly known as the Jarck's Vanda, is a tropical orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its long, pendulous stems and showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shady environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), helping it retain moisture in its natural habitat. Aerides jarckiana is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
